revised_title: Relativistic Interaction of Two Electrons in the Self-Consistent Field Method
tldr: The authors present a study on the relativistic interaction of two electrons using the self-consistent field method. They introduce the spin interaction and the effect of retardation in the calculations and apply the method to evaluate the separations of the components of the helium term. The study provides a deeper understanding of the interaction energy of two electrons and its implications in atomic physics.
